intro: Phania urenifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phania, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in shrubland and along coastal areas, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
